HikesNA.title: Sunny Peak
HikesNA.description: This intermidiate level hike is a fan favorite. The trail is well laid and the peak is nice in warm during the summer months

HikesNA.title: Grover's Passage
HikesNA.description: A beginner level hike that is fun for all ages. This forest path has small stops along the path with information about the surrounding plants and wildlife

HikesNA.title: The Dragon's Spine
HikesNA.description: This hike should only be attempted by advanced level hikers. The trail is somewhat trecherous and snakes over the mountains. Its perfect for anyone seeking adventure!

HikesNA.title: Wonderland
HikesNA.description: This winter hike is great for those who don't mind colder temperatures. You will leave your mark as you travel across this winter wonderland, just make sure to dress warm

HikesNA.title: The Merry March
HikesNA.description: This hiking loop is brimming with some of the best senery North America has to offer. As you traverse through this evergreen forest you will meet all kinds of wildlife.

HikesEU.title: Moss Managerie
HikesEU.description: This hike will take you through a vibrant forest overrun with moss. Its stunning visuals rival that of any other hike in the continent of Europe.

HikesEU.title: Teetering Falls
HikesEU.description: This hike is a long and difficult trek, but the falls at the end make it worth it. We advise that you do not swim near the falls.

HikesEU.title: The Nomad's Way
HikesEU.description: Walk amongst the clouds on this spectacular path. It was recently redone so it is the perfect time to give it a try!

HikesEU.title: Lord of Lakes
HikesEU.description: This lake is a popular spot for travelers of all kinds. The mountain winds and freezing lake can make temperatures quite cold, so prepare accordingly.

HikesEU.title: Dusty Dunes
HikesEU.description: This hike is not for the faint of heart. The slippery sand makes for difficult footing and tired feet, but if you crave a desert adventure you've found your trail!
